oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hosley Chapel CME: side
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hosley Chapel Christian Methodist Episcopal Church

Color photograph of Hosley Chapel CME church's side. The brick building features a cross gable plan. The rear addition contains a door on its facade and another on its side. Two bays of windows appear on the side of the main section. A parking lot sits next to the building.

Hosley Chapel CME is a rural African American church in Gadsden, Tennessee. Prominent pastors throughout the church's history include Reverend J.C. Williams (1938), Reverend Charles Ward (1953), Reverend Randall Campbell (1980), and Reverend Reginald Purham (1981). Between 1953 and 1980, the current building was constructed and remodeled.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
